content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my risk-taking nature, I would choose to play this game as an opportunity for potential high rewards. However, since I don't know the strategy of my anonymous partner, I will need to consider a mix of strategies.

I believe that if I consistently pick R (Risky strategy), there is a chance that my partner might catch on and start picking B more often in response, potentially lowering my earnings. On the other hand, if I pick B (Conservative strategy) more frequently, I would secure a more stable income of 40$ per round, but at the cost of missing out on potential higher payoffs if my partner also picks B.

Considering these factors and taking advantage of my risk-taking nature, I will choose R as my first move in this game (R{R}). But it is important to note that adapting my strategy based on the results of each round would be essential for optimizing my earnings throughout the 75 rounds.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In this case, since my partner and I both picked R in the previous round, we received a payoff of 45$ each. As a risk-taker, I will try to maximize potential earnings by switching strategies for the next round (B{R}). This way, if my partner sticks with their previous choice of R, I would receive a higher payoff of 35$, whereas if they change their strategy and pick B, I would earn 40$.

It is important to remember that adapting strategies based on the results of each round can help optimize earnings throughout the game.
